tags: a song of ice and fire
question: Bran for the ask meme
answer:
Concerning the UFO Sighting Near Highland, Illinois- Sufjan Stevens

Mysterious shade that took its form (or what it was!)
Incarnation, three stars
Delivering signs and dusting from their eyes

On Your Wings- Iron and Wine

All these men that you made
how we wither in the shade
of your trees, on your wings
we are carried to the sea

God, give us love in the time that we have

Welcome Home- Radical Face

All my nightmares escape my head
Bar the door, please don’t let them in
You were never supposed to leave
Now my head’s splitting at the seams
And I don’t know if I can

blog.name: chitowngirl-12
blog.title: Chicago Diva
blog.description: I'm a fan of Jon, the North, and the Starks.  Not a Jonsa, but an ally because they are nice, rational people unlike other parts of GOT fandom that will remain nameless.  (Apparently I'm also a sexist crazy person for having bad, ungood opinions about Daenerys Targaryen!  And I also set up alts and post anonymous comments and talk to myself on AO3...  Sarc off.  Yeah, fandom is pissing me off right now.)

summary: I don't believe Dany is the savior of the North.  I believe that Bran will be the one to defeat the Night King.  He lost the use...
question: I don't believe Dany is the savior of the North.  I believe that Bran will be the one to defeat the Night King.  He lost the use of his legs to gain the powers necessary to defeat him.  He's not doing it for any gain for himself.  This is the boy who surrendered Winterfell to Theon so there wouldn't be any further bloodshed.  I think Dany will be ineffective in saving the North.
answer: I agree with you that Bran is important.  He is the “Frodo” of Game of Thrones - the true hero.  However, a confession is that I have trouble rooting for him as a character.  I find his storyline too high fantasy for my liking and I think the writers tend to use him as a crutch to provide information.  I loved the Tower of Joy sequence, but I thought Bran conveniently remembering everything Littlefinger said in Season 7 was too much.  I’m also annoyed that they cut the story about the Knight of the Laughing Tree and the Tournament at Harrenhal.

reblog.comment: I agree with you that Bran is important.  He is the “Frodo” of Game of Thrones - the true hero.  However, a confession is that I have trouble rooting for him as a character.  I find his storyline too high fantasy for my liking and I think the writers tend to use him as a crutch to provide information.  I loved the Tower of Joy sequence, but I thought Bran conveniently remembering everything Littlefinger said in Season 7 was too much.  I’m also annoyed that they cut the story about the Knight of the Laughing Tree and the Tournament at Harrenhal.

summary: Since Bran originally wants to be a knight, do you think Cat and Ned were considering fostering him elsewhere, pre-AGOT? Would...
question: Since Bran originally wants to be a knight, do you think Cat and Ned were considering fostering him elsewhere, pre-AGOT? Would he just go to the Manderlys, since they're Northern but have Knights, or somewhere in the South (Riverrun, maybe?)?
answer:
Pre-AGOT I really don’t think Cat and Ned had settled on any plans for any of their children. At the start of AGOT, Bran was supposed to go with Ned to King’s Landing, where no doubt he would have begun a knight’s training. Perhaps, in time (in a world where the rest of the plot doesn’t happen), Bran might have become Barristan Selmy’s squire?

But say it’s a world where the plot doesn’t happen and Ned and Cat are taking action regarding their children’s futures. You can see my thoughts along those lines here – and for Bran, while it’s possible he could have had knight’s training under Ser Rodrik Cassel, it would be more prestigious for him to be fostered elsewhere. While the Manderlys are a possibility, I think it’s more likely that Bran would have become his uncle Edmure’s squire (and possibly heir, if Edmure remains a bachelor). Or possibly if Sansa gets a nice betrothal, Bran would come along with her to be a squire to whomever she’s betrothed to (or a relative if her promised isn’t a knight yet), like Edric Dayne did for Beric Dondarrion. And you never know, but especially since the Kingsguard was Bran’s big dream, the Barristan option is still out there…

For those on mobile, here is my ship list: https://incorrect-got-quotes.tumblr.com/list-of-ships Main: garnetislovegarnetislife. SUBMISSION BOX IS (MOST LIKELY) PERMANENTLY CLOSED!

summary: So what do you think is Euron's ultimate fate?  Is he undone by Asha & Theon, or does he unleash some Cthulhu-ish monstrosity...
question: So what do you think is Euron's ultimate fate?  Is he undone by Asha & Theon, or does he unleash some Cthulhu-ish monstrosity that makes him its first victim?  Could he be betrayed and killed by Victarion?
answer: I tend to think that either Bran, Dany, or both together take out Euron. Picking up the pieces looks to me like a job for Asha.

reblog.comment: I tend to think that either Bran, Dany, or both together take out Euron. Picking up the pieces looks to me like a job for Asha.

question: bran stark
answer:
character: hate them | don’t really care | like them | LOVE them | THEY ARE MY PRECIOUS

ship with: Meera

friendship them with: His remaining siblings, Hodor :(, Jojen :(, Osha :(

general opinions: Until season 7, I enjoyed him and his storyline a lot. Then it seemed like D&D were too lazy to give him a proper plot and chose to waste everyone’s time with this ridiculously stupid Winterfell drama instead. I sometimes wonder what they were thinking when they wrote his script. “He lived under a tree for a while… let’s make him act like one”? (Meera deserved so much better!) I hope he becomes important again in season 8.

Thank you! :)

put a character in my ask
